Title.evidence: Design, Setting, and Participants: For this randomized clinical trial

Trial_Design.evidence: patients with established type 2 diabetes and microalbuminuria were recruited from a single center from April 1, 2013, through March 31, 2016, with a 5-year follow-up

Participants.evidence: patients with established type 2 diabetes and microalbuminuria were recruited from a single center

Intervention.evidence: randomized 1:1 to receive best medical treatment (n = 49) or RYGB (n = 51)

Objective.evidence: Objective: To compare the albuminuria-lowering effects of Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB) surgery vs best medical treatment

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was remission of albuminuria (uACR <30 mg/g).

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 100 patients (mean [SD] age, 51.4 [7.6] years; 55 [55%] male) were randomized: 51 to RYGB and 49 to best medical care.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 100 patients (mean [SD] age, 51.4 [7.6] years; 55 [55%] male) were randomized: 51 to RYGB and 49 to best medical care.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Remission of albuminuria occurred in 55% of patients (95% CI, 39%-70%) after best medical treatment and 82% of patients (95% CI, 72%-93%) after RYGB ( P = .006)

Harms.evidence: No difference in the rate of serious adverse events was observed.
